laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver is normal without focal or textural abnormality; main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow; gallbladder contains several calcified gallstones; a 13 x 9 mm non-shadowing stone or sludge ball is present; gallbladder is distended but there is no wall edema or pericholecystic fluid; common duct measures 5 mm with no intra- or extra-hepatic bile duct dilatation; visualized portion of the pancreas is normal.
